channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Life, liberty and the very American pursuit of humor
item.description: The Declaration of Independence states that all men have certain "unalienable rights." From Mark Twain to Jon Stewart, satirists have picked apart that guarantee and what politicians do to honor it.
item.content:encoded: The Declaration of Independence states that all men have certain "unalienable rights." From Mark Twain to Jon Stewart, satirists have picked apart that guarantee and what politicians do to honor it.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Students' push for change results in new Latino history exhibit in Chicago
item.description: A group of Latino high school students in Chicago didn't feel represented by a local museum. They successfully petitioned the museum, resulting in a new exhibit reflecting local Latino history.
item.content:encoded: A group of Latino high school students in Chicago didn't feel represented by a local museum. They successfully petitioned the museum, resulting in a new exhibit reflecting local Latino history.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Pupovac

item.title: A daughter reexamines her own family story in 'The Mixed Marriage Project'
item.description: Dorothy Roberts' parents, a white anthropologist and a Black woman from Jamaica, spent years interviewing interracial couples in Chicago. Her memoir draws from their records.
item.content:encoded:
Dorothy Roberts' parents, a white anthropologist and a Black woman from Jamaica, spent years interviewing interracial couples in Chicago. Her memoir draws from their records.

(Image credit: Cris Crisman)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Reporter's notebook: A Dutch speedskater and a U.S. influencer walk into a bar …
item.description: NPR's Rachel Treisman took a pause from watching figure skaters break records to see speed skaters break records. Plus, the surreal experience of watching backflip artist Ilia Malinin.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Rachel Treisman took a pause from watching figure skaters break records to see speed skaters break records. Plus, the surreal experience of watching backflip artist Ilia Malinin.

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'E-bike for your feet': How bionic sneakers could change human mobility
item.description: Nike's battery-powered footwear system, which propels wearers forward, is part of a broader push to help humans move farther and faster.
item.content:encoded:
Nike's battery-powered footwear system, which propels wearers forward, is part of a broader push to help humans move farther and faster.

(Image credit: Gritchelle Fallesgon for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Students' push for change results in new Latino history exhibit in Chicago
item.description: Curators and museum leadership typically form and select exhibits. It was high school students though that helped change an exhibit about Latino culture in Chicago. Aqui en Chicago is now open.
item.content:encoded: Curators and museum leadership typically form and select exhibits.  It was high school students though that helped change an exhibit about Latino culture in Chicago.  Aqui en Chicago is now open.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Pupovac

item.title: Double Dutch is having a moment
item.description: Double Dutch is experiencing a comeback. The jump rope style, which involves two ropes turned in opposite directions, has been kept alive in the Black community.
item.content:encoded: Double Dutch is experiencing a comeback. The jump rope style, which involves two ropes turned in opposite directions, has been kept alive in the Black community.
item.dc:creator: Leslie E. Thompson

item.title: The glass left from yahrzeit candles can be another way to memorialize a loved one
item.description: In Jewish tradition, after someone dies, the anniversary of their death is marked by lighting a yahrzeit candle. It comes in a stubby glass holder. In some families, that old glass found a new use.
item.content:encoded: In Jewish tradition, after someone dies, the anniversary of their death is marked by lighting a yahrzeit candle. It comes in a stubby glass holder. In some families, that old glass found a new use.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Bad Bunny's joyful defiance captivates Super Bowl halftime
item.description: Bad Bunny delivered a joyful 13-minute Super Bowl halftime performance with a message of unity as well as pride in Latin American culture at a time when many Latinos in the U.S. feel under attack.
item.content:encoded: Bad Bunny delivered a joyful 13-minute Super Bowl halftime performance with a message of unity as well as pride in Latin American culture at a time when many Latinos in the U.S. feel under attack.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Ilia Malinin's Olympic backflip made history. But he's not the first to do it
item.description: U.S. figure skating phenom Ilia Malinin did a backflip in his Olympic debut, and another the next day. The controversial move was banned from competition for decades until 2024.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. figure skating phenom Ilia Malinin did a backflip in his Olympic debut, and another the next day. The controversial move was banned from competition for decades until 2024.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
